title: Perma-Suspended for use of Custom Skins?
body:
**NOTE:**
I posted in General Discussion, then it was suggested to me to also post here. 
Link to OP: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/GD/0dFGwM3b-banned-for-use-of-custom-skins

**Alrighty Summoners!**

I'm here to discuss why I was banned, and why I feel it may have been a false positive.
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}} 
Last week I received an e-mail letting me know:

_Your account: drock55555 was banned due to the use of malicious 3rd party programs or modifications to your League of Legends client. We believe that all players should play on equal footing in an effort to promote competitive sportsmanship. You should be aware that modifying your League of Legends client is against the Terms of Use: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse. We hope you can see that it is unsatisfying to play against other players who are using a tool to gain an advantage over others._

I followed up through the support ticket the last week and after discussing with Player Support, their final answer was:

_I must reiterate that we cannot comment on programs that we do not officially support. However, our system did detect usage of exploits that seriously violated our Terms of Use. In the end, we will not be changing our decision regarding this case._

The confusion I had with my ban, as many others have within the past week. The only modifications I have made were the rebinding of my Champion Mastery Emote to my spells (Q,W,E,R,D,F), and I installed custom skins via a program called Wooxy. The programs only function is to add purely cosmetic changes such as custom skins for champions and maps as I screenshot below. While using the program I had three skins which were Demon Illoai, Dark Side Yi, and Surprise Party Rengar.

http://i.imgur.com/cNayiT4.png
http://i.imgur.com/1R862v6.png
http://i.imgur.com/Im7bzDP.png 

I did some poking around viewing my files to reassure myself of any modifications that I was not aware of, and my findings validated my suspicion. The only files affected/modified were the config file to rebind my Champion Mastery Emote, as well as some champion models due to the skins I had. For those that are interested, screenshots below with a short description of where the file path is.

http://i.imgur.com/u9wU6t0.png 
(C:\Riot Games)
http://i.imgur.com/GktWfGs.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)
http://i.imgur.com/4Su6aEj.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config)
http://i.imgur.com/YfsXhvL.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config\Champions)
http://i.imgur.com/KC6ff0U.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs)
http://i.imgur.com/CYvHDMD.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS)
http://i.imgur.com/P4xBYjj.png 
(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\temp)


**SO MANY LINKS IM SORRY**
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}} 

http://i.imgur.com/YWpiWmE.png 
(C:\Wooxy)
http://i.imgur.com/qz5nM5z.png 
(C:\Wooxy\skins)
http://i.imgur.com/dQRcTeS.gifv (C:\Wooxy\backup\l3cdn.riotgames.com\releases\live\lol_air_client\0.0.1.31\assets\images\champions)
http://i.imgur.com/HrKOMs3.png 
(C:\Wooxy\images)
http://i.imgur.com/UtZKNwz.png 
(C:\Wooxy\images\champions)


With all that being said, I want to know opinions and hear from others affected, because to what I see and know about the usage of custom skins, they are more of a warning instead of an instant perma-ban by Riot.

Thank you for your time, and I hope you all Stay Victorious!

-Derrick/VG Drock55555

replies.body:
Heya Derrick,

I appreciate the thoroughly documented screencaps, but we don't currently suspend for the use of Wooxy or other skin installers (if that's their only functionality).  You were detected using a scripting application, and even though your account was being shared at the time, we still hold it responsible for the actions taken.

I've spent some time investigating your claims, and like some other cases recently, it looks like you allowed someone else access to your account in October of last season.  They played a few games on your behalf (34 to be precise), and while it may've gained you a few divisions, it also netted a permanent suspension for the abuse of 3rd party programs.  

It's also important to note that boosters tend to utilize cheats for a faster service, and because banwaves are delayed to appropriately occlude detection methodology, they can do some significant damage to your ranked integrity.  There's never really a good reason to share your account, and those seeking additional security guidelines can level up [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account#h2q1).

While i know nothing about the support system for this kind of situation as I haven't been banned before. It seems like there is something to be said with people coming here to the boards being banned and not sure why. While they probably knew better than to share their accounts with boosters they still don't know that the booster may have used a script or something and it seems like player support isn't telling them this.

Like i said, I don't know how the support system handles these cases and I suspect there are far more that exist than the ones where people have come to the boards only to be smited down by rioters who look into the case, but it seems like in the original email where he was banned it did not specify what the third party software was which led to this confusion. And it seems he wasn't told any of this through player support, ie the, your account was shared then and thats where the scripting came from.

Wouldn't it save a lot of embarrassment for the punished player and some time for you here if the automated messages were more specific about the ban and if the player support gave more information when requested?

Like I said, I haven't experienced the player support system in this kind of situation (thankfully) so I don't know if this is already the norm or not. I'm just making an observation based on some of the threads like this i've seen.

Player support is also empowered to look into these cases to make sure there's no error, but the response is usually the same: it's the players' choice to give someone else full permission to do whatever they please with their account, which includes allowing someone to use their account to script, and it will be them who are held accountable.

For most of these cases that we're clarifying here, the person borrowing the account was using scripts to boost it, so the owner wasn't being considerate of how other players would feel about being unfairly placed against a higher-skilled/scripting opponent in the first place.

Ohhhh. I see where the initial hostility came from. Back when LoL first was made, people could gigantically abuse the system, and a few people burdened by a partial form of psychopathy did that (such as the guy who did this abuse), causing resentment to be imprinted into the collective consciousness of the whole community for nearly 7 years .. even _after_ the order-producing measures were put into place. Through the "butterfly effect", these initial causes have produced the chain of events (effect) that nearly everybody became hostile and distrustful to one another, and the community largely still operates in this same mentality of paranoia and distrust even today.

Let's let the ugly past go. If we stay on the same track of paranoia and distrust, then even long after the part-psychopaths have gone, we are still letting them ruin our game by the echo of their actions.
That's why we need a sandbox mode. ^^
